definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony

sentences.english: Could China weather the subsequent financial turmoil as stoically as Japan?
sentences.chinese: 中國在經歷如此的金融風暴後會像日本一樣的堅忍麼？

sentences.english: When confronted with financial storm, are you at a loss?
sentences.chinese: 面對席捲而來的金融風暴，您是否手足無措？

sentences.english: Where is the real"danger"of Financial storm?
sentences.chinese: 金融風暴我們“危”在何處？

sentences.english: What is Beyondsoft’s attitude and reaction toward the financial crises storm?
sentences.chinese: 如今面對金融風暴博顏有怎樣的應對態度和措施？

sentences.english: THE crisis began on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 本次全球金融風暴，濫觴於美國華爾街。

sentences.english: The past two years, the financial turmoil sweeping the globe, bringing a Qifeng miserable rain.
sentences.chinese: 近兩年，金融風暴席捲全球，帶來一片悽風慘雨。

definition: hot money, money flowing from one currency to another in the hope of quick profit
to break out (of disease etc)/to suddenly get rich (or prominent)
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
Tung Chee-hwa (1937-), Hong Kong entrepreneur and politician, chief executive 1997-2005
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
